intro: Deschampsia mezensis, commonly known as mezen’s bluegrass, is a perennial grass species native to northern regions of North America. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows, bogs, and stream banks. The plant features fine, blue-green blades with a distinctive bluish tinge, and its inflorescence consists of a loose panicle of spikelets. It is well adapted to wet conditions and can tolerate partial shade. Deschampsia mezensis plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
